attributes.value: Broadside ballads are single sheets of paper printed on one side with song lyrics. These ballads were about love, religion, legends, current events, etc. and were printed and circulated in large quantities. They were popular from the 16th through the 19th centuries in England, Ireland, and North America.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: Nineteenth-century London printers of broadside ballad sheets supplied both traditional and original songs to "hawkers and the trade," as well as selling to customers in their own shops. Most compositions are anonymous (though their authors are sometimes named or identifiable) and they enjoyed a wide audience. This collection contains 49 publications from a variety of printers, including the heirs of John Pitts and James Catnach (Elizabeth Hodges and Anne Ryle, respectively) and Henry P. Such. Researchers interested in nineteenth-century popular song or the London printing trade will find this collection of use.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: This collection contains two volumes of poems and ballads titled Mes vers by Herminie Delavault spanning the years 1840 to 1879. Written in French, the works also include verse created for the musical compositions by Delavault's husband Germain-Eug√®ne Delavault (1814-1892). In addition, volume two contains a French translation of John Gay's libretto for Handel's Acis and Galatea.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: Music, Education, College teachers, and Tell, William -- Legends
attributes.label: Subject

attributes.value: Miscellaneous papers of Marion Dexter Learned related to his scholarly work and academic career. Most of the items, including manuscript fragments, notes, and research materials, pertain to an unfinished scholarly project in which Learned sought to illuminate the literary evolution of the Wilhelm Tell legend and ballad, from its beginnings to the publication of a version of the ballad in Philadelphia in 1768 by the German-born printer Heinrich Miller. Other items in the collection include miscellaneous correspondence; two personal documents of Learned from graduate study in Leipzig, Germany; print copies of two speeches by him; and miscellaneous research materials and publications collected by him.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.title: Sheldon Hackney research notes on African American history, civil rights, and folk songs

attributes.value: Sheldon Hackney research notes on African American history, civil rights, and folk songs
attributes.label: Title

attributes.value: African Americans -- History, Folk songs, and Civil rights movements -- United States
attributes.label: Subject

attributes.value: Sheldon Hackney (1933-2013) was a historian of the American south, an academic administrator, and the chairman of the National Endowment for the Humanities during the Clinton administration. This collection consists of a very small number of papers created by Sheldon Hackney and includes research notes and audio recordings relating to his research on African American history, the Civil Rights Movement and folk life and folk song.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.title: Charles Godfrey Leland letters to George Henry Boker

attributes.value: Charles Godfrey Leland letters to George Henry Boker
attributes.label: Title

attributes.value: Charles Godfrey Leland (1824-1903) was a humorist and folklorist from Philadelphia. The collection consists of fourteen illustrated letters written to George Henry Boker which document one year of Leland's trip to Europe from 1869 to 1870; transcriptions of the letters; and an article by donor and scholar Sculley Bradley about the collection.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: A volume containing excerpts and quotations of various authors compiled anonomously in England between the years 1805 to 1820.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: Literature, Clubs, History -- Societies, etc, Jews, and Literature -- Societies, etc
attributes.label: Subject

attributes.value: The effusions, a collection of volumes consists of several issues of a handmade magazine bound in one volume.  The magazine was created by the Philadelphia club named Ell Kube and was founded by a group of young Jewish men in 1904.  There are seven volumes spanning the years from 1905-1914.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: This is a collection of miscellaneous music material, including manuscript scores, printed scores, and printed sheet music.  In addition to the music material, there is a letter and a photograph which were sent to Benedict Nenninger.
attributes.label: Abstract

attributes.value: Education, College teachers, Literature, and Drama -- History and criticism
attributes.label: Subject

attributes.value: Arthur Hawley "Joe" Scouten was a scholar of British literature and theater and a University of Pennsylvania professor. This collection contains a small amount of his research materials and correspondence, as well as some biographical and memorial materials and a number of his school and work records.
attributes.label: Abstract
